Supplier Security Control Sensitivities..Control: Ensure HTTPS is enabled
Ensure SSL/TLS implementations are up to date and properly configured
Ensure all collected personal data is properly protected using encryption at rest and in transit
There is a process for secure provisioning of keys that includes generation -  distribution -  revocation and destruction. For example in compliance with FIPS140-2 [ref 5] or similar process.
Ensure all communication between system components is encrypted as well as encrypting traffic between the system or device and the internet
Collect data only if it has business-use or is essential to the functioning of the IoT device
Use data only with prior permission of all interested parties.
Organization of information security (roles and responsibilities to ensure information security) is defined for the consumer.

A process is in place for consistent briefing of senior executives in the event of the identification of a vulnerability or a security breach -  especially those who may deal with the media or make public announcements. In particular that any public statements made in the event of a security breach -  should give as full and accurate account of the facts as possible.
Ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Ensure periodic internal audits are conducted.
Ensure periodic third-party audits are conducted.
Ensure that asset owners are informed about what data is collected -  why -  where it will be stored.
Ensure asset owners check/verify what data is collected and delete data if necessary.r
Ensure business continuity disaster recovery plans exist and are tested regularly.

Whenever there is collection of data -  a privacy and acceptance notice must be acknowledged by the entity prior to providing the data. This notice must state the company's policy on data collection -  usage -  and retention.
Retain data for only as long as necessary.

There are documented information security policies and procedures based on accepted standards -  guidelines -  and other documentation. Required policies for IoT include policies on asset management -  access control -  physical security -  communications security -  systems security -  incident management -  business continuity and compliance. Required procedures for IoT include procedures on patch management -  exception management -  change management -  incident managment -  access control managment (user activation/deactivation and privilege management).
A policy has been established for dealing with both internal and third party security research on the products or services.
There is a secure notification process based upon the IoTSF _ Vulnerability Disclosure Guidelines_ or similar recognised process -  for notifying partners/ users of any security updates.
There is a role -  typically a board level executive -  who takes ownership of and is responsible for product -  service and business level security.

Delete unnecessary applications on IoT devices
All the applicable security features supported by the OS are enabled.r
Ensure web application firewall is enabled where available

Collect data only if it has business-use or is essential to the functioning of the IoT device
Ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Use data only with prior permission of all interested parties.
Retain data for only as long as necessary.

Required policies for IoT include policies on asset management -  access control -  physical security -  communications security -  systems security -  incident management -  business continuity and compliance. Required procedures for IoT include procedures on patch management -  exception management -  change management -  incident managment -  access control managment (user activation/deactivation and privilege management).

Apply jamming countermeasures
The access control privileges are defined -  justified and documented.
Change the default password to a strong one and if possible change the default username as well
Enable account lockout functionality where available
Ensure two factor authentication is enabled where available
Enable making a periodic change of passwords mandatory (for example the duration could be 90 days)

The product only allows controlled user account access; access using anonymous or guest user accounts are not supported without justification.

Access granted to employees is periodically reviewed.
All interactive operating system accounts or logins have been disabled.

Check to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal.
